messages.author: qinmin
messages.text:
On 2013/09/10 16:00:58, xhwang wrote:
> fix order

Done.

messages.author: xhwang
messages.text: hmm, native code won't understand what "OMX.google.aac.decoder" is. So we have to translate this into something like "aac" or "mp4a" at some point. If we have to do the translation later, does it make sense to keep a list of codec names instead of searializing it into a comma separated string, which we have to parse again later for translation?

messages.author: qinmin
messages.text:
That's a good question for David.
David, what is the expected codec format in KeySystemInfo?
Are you expecting aac or something like OMX.google.aac.decoder？ And how do we differentiate .secure codecs?

On 2013/09/10 16:00:58, xhwang wrote:
> hmm, native code won't understand what "OMX.google.aac.decoder" is. So we have
> to translate this into something like "aac" or "mp4a" at some point. If we have
> to do the translation later, does it make sense to keep a list of codec names
> instead of searializing it into a comma separated string, which we have to parse
> again later for translation?

messages.author: qinmin
messages.text:
On 2013/09/10 16:00:58, xhwang wrote:
> Append period.

Done.
